question_stem.en: A 66-year-old man hospitalized 3 days ago for left lower lobe pneumonia is evaluated for persistent fever. He has been receiving the appropriate intravenous antibiotics as determined by antibiotic susceptibility testing of his sputum cultures. The patient has a history of diabetes mellitus and hypertension. His temperature is 38 C (100.4 F) and pulse is 87/min. Examination shows dullness to percussion and decreased breath sounds over the left lower lung. Imaging studies reveal a loculated, left-sided pleural effusion. A tube is placed to drain the fluid via an incision at the 5th intercostal space in the midaxillary line. {{exhibit_1}}
question_stem.zh: 一名66岁男性，因左下肺肺炎住院3天，现评估持续发热。患者已接受了适当的静脉抗生素治疗，这由其痰培养物的药敏试验确定。该患者有糖尿病和高血压病史。体温38°C（100.4°F），脉搏87次/分钟。体格检查显示左下肺叩诊浊音，呼吸音减弱。影像学检查显示局限性左侧胸腔积液。经在腋中线第五肋间隙切口置入导管引流积液。{{exhibit_1}}

question.en: Which of the following muscles is most likely to be dissected during the procedure?
question.zh: 在手术过程中，以下哪块肌肉最有可能被解剖？

explanation.en:
This patient most likely has empyema requiring drainage with a chest tube. The technique involves placing the chest tube through the skin and subcutaneous fat into the 4th or 5th intercostal space in the anterior axillary or midaxillary line. The tube traverses through the serratus anterior muscle, intercostal (external, internal, innermost) muscles, and parietal pleura to reach the pleural cavity. {{exhibit_2}}

The serratus anterior originates as multiple branches from the side of the chest along the 1st-8th ribs and inserts along the entire length of the medial scapular border. The muscle is divided into 3 parts (superior, intermediate, inferior) depending on the insertion site at the scapula. The inferior part of the muscle facilitates arm elevation by pulling the lower end of the scapula forward (scapular rotation). All 3 muscle parts can help with respiration by lifting the ribs when the shoulder girdle is fixed.

(Choice A) The external oblique originates from the lateral ribs (5-12) and extends anteriorly across the abdomen to insert into the linea alba, pubis, and iliac crest of the hip bones. The muscle is usually inferior to the chest tube insertion site.

(Choice B) The infraspinatus is a rotator cuff muscle that attaches medially to the infraspinous fossa of the scapula and laterally to the greater tubercle of the humerus. The muscle stabilizes the shoulder joint in addition to externally rotating the humerus.

(Choice C) The latissimus dorsi is a back muscle that helps with multiple shoulder movements (eg, extension, adduction). It originates from the spinous processes of T7-L5, the 9th-12th ribs, and the inferior angle of the scapula. The muscle inserts into the humerus and is located posterior to the chest tube insertion site.

(Choice D) The pectoralis major arises from the anterior clavicle, sternum, costal cartilages, and aponeurosis of the external oblique muscle. It attaches on the lateral lip of the bicipital groove of the humerus and serves to adduct and internally rotate the humerus. The muscle is anterior to the chest tube insertion site.

Educational objective:
A chest tube for drainage of pleural effusion is placed through the skin and subcutaneous fat into the 4th or 5th intercostal space in the anterior axillary or midaxillary line. The tube traverses through the serratus anterior muscle, intercostal muscles, and parietal pleura. {{exhibit_3}}
explanation.zh:
该患者最有可能患有需要胸管引流的脓胸。该技术包括将胸管穿过皮肤和皮下脂肪，置入腋前线或腋中线的第4或第5肋间隙。导管穿过前锯肌、肋间肌（外肋间肌、内肋间肌、最内肋间肌）和壁层胸膜，到达胸膜腔。{{exhibit_2}}

前锯肌起源于胸部侧面的多条分支，沿着第1-8肋骨分布，并沿着肩胛骨内侧缘的整个长度插入。根据在肩胛骨上的插入位置，该肌肉被分为3个部分（上部、中部、下部）。该肌肉的下部通过拉动肩胛骨的下端向前（肩胛骨旋转）来促进手臂抬高。所有3个肌肉部分都可以通过在肩带固定时抬高肋骨来帮助呼吸。

(选项A) 腹外斜肌起源于肋骨外侧（5-12），并向前延伸穿过腹部，插入腹白线、耻骨和髋骨的髂嵴。该肌肉通常位于胸管插入部位的下方。

(选项B) 冈下肌是肩袖肌肉，内侧附着于肩胛骨的冈下窝，外侧附着于肱骨大结节。该肌肉除了向外旋转肱骨外，还能稳定肩关节。

(选项C) 背阔肌是背部肌肉，有助于肩部的多重运动（例如，伸展、内收）。它起源于T7-L5的棘突、第9-12肋骨和肩胛骨的下角。该肌肉插入肱骨，位于胸管插入部位的后方。

(选项D) 胸大肌起自锁骨前部、胸骨、肋软骨和腹外斜肌的腱膜。它附着在肱骨双股沟的外侧唇上，并用于内收和内旋肱骨。该肌肉位于胸管插入部位的前方。

教育目标：
用于引流胸腔积液的胸管穿过皮肤和皮下脂肪，置入腋前线或腋中线的第4或第5肋间隙。导管穿过前锯肌、肋间肌和壁层胸膜。{{exhibit_3}}

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of the anatomical layers traversed during chest tube placement, specifically the muscles encountered in the midaxillary line. It requires understanding the location and orientation of the serratus anterior muscle in relation to the intercostal spaces.

To solve this question, recall the typical chest tube insertion site (4th or 5th intercostal space, midaxillary line) and visualize the anatomical layers. The serratus anterior muscle overlies the ribs in this region, making it the most likely muscle to be dissected.
summary.zh:
这个问题测试了关于胸管放置过程中穿过的解剖层面的知识，特别是腋中线遇到的肌肉。它需要理解前锯肌相对于肋间隙的位置和方向。

要解决这个问题，回想一下典型的胸管插入部位（第4或第5肋间隙，腋中线）并可视化解剖层。前锯肌覆盖该区域的肋骨，使其成为最有可能被解剖的肌肉。

tags: Chest tube placement; Serratus anterior muscle; Pleural effusion; Empyema; Thoracic anatomy; Intercostal space; Midaxillary line
